messages.subject: Husband had a question
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/9/01 12:19:19 PM US Mountain Standard Time, ... This was great Pam as it bought up more issues other than this.  The reason Steve takes
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/9/01 12:19:19 PM US Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> First, Steve could determine if he "needs to" go to Target to exchange
> something right-that-minute, or can it wait an hour if need be? If it really
> can't wait (he's under a deadline on the project, it has be done now) and
> there is no one else available to watch the kids, and they are too young to
> remain on their own, then they wouldn't have a choice. PAM

This was great Pam as it bought up more issues other than this. The reason
Steve takes the kids when I'm working is so that they are not making too much
noise or bankging on my door, or Max (nearly 2) coming looking for me and
crying at my door. That sounds terrible and as I thought about it decided
that I need to change my work schedule again so that doesn't need to happen.

Whew this is exhausting thinking of the chances that I need to make in order
to unschool him in the way I'd really like too and to have a lifestyle I
really want. (LOL)

Dawn

"The people who get on in this world
are people who get up and look for the
circumstances they want, and,
if they can't find them, make them." - George Bernard Shaw

"The only time my education was interrupted was when I was in school."-George
Bernard Shaw
